intro: Cineraria aurantiaca var. intermedia, commonly known as the hybrid cineraria, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its striking orange and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and has hairy, gray-green leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade. This variety is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its vibrant blooms and compact growth habit.
